entries.content: Use the initial call to uncover if the prospect has problems or symptoms that your solution can fix.
entries.notes: Focuses on identifying the root cause of potential issues.

entries.content: Uncover if the prospect has any intention of fixing the problem or has already tried to fix it.
entries.notes: Helps understand past attempts and current motivation related to the root cause.

entries.content: Determine if the problem is costing the prospect money.
entries.notes: Quantifies the impact of the root cause, helps isolate 'cost' or 'ROI' objections.

entries.content: Find out if the prospect believes fixing the problem would improve their situation.
entries.notes: Connects the root cause to desired outcomes, addressing 'status quo' objections.

entries.content: Ascertain if the prospect is currently considering looking at solutions.
entries.notes: Helps understand urgency and priority, addressing 'timing' objections.

entries.content: Qualify if the prospect is willing to invite you to explore solutions further based on the uncovered needs.
entries.notes: Isolates willingness to engage after understanding the root cause.

focus_area: Objection Discovery: Clarifying questions, isolation, root cause
